answers.answer: First of all...welcome here!  This is a rather small group that has not been very active but I have severe neuropathy both peripheral and small fiber autonomic.  I get great relief with Metanx which is not covered by my insurance but I have found a place to get it at lower cost.There is a lot of information and papers published linking statins to neuropathy.  This is not in your head it is really happening.  I have a familial type of high cholesterol and being a compliant patient tried every statin known to man and even zetia and found they all increased pain plus I had some allergic reactions to them so refuse to take any.  I took high doses of niaspan and used Welchol but a recent surgery left me unable to continue with the niaspan so just take Welchol now.I put in a search engine search for articles.  You can scroll down these  to find documentation.http://www.dogpile.com/search/web?q=increased+neuropathy+on+statinsHope this helps and am happy to exchange information....Marie

question: I am presently receiving treatment for diabetes and heart disease from the Veteran's Administration.  Atorvastatin has just been added to the VA formulary and my doctor jumped at the chance to switch me from  Zocor.  I have noticed a significant increase in the level of peripheral neuropathy in both my feet and hands.  The pain is chronic and extreme and I am wanting to know if there are any new studies indicating a connection between these symptoms and the lipitor?  I am getting desperate!!!!!
title: Lipitor and neuropathy?
